SEARCH
Package sttrswing.model.validator

Class InputHandler

Object
InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
Responsible for handling user input, uses a given Validator to validate user input, and a given String for the user prompt to print.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    InputHandler()
    Constructs a InputHandler instance with a default generic Validator and a default prompt of "default prompt".

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    get()
    Prints out the current prompt and requests user input, checks that input against the Validator isValid method to determine if the InputHandler can return that input or if it has to ask the user again.
    void
    resetValidator()
    Resets the InputHandler to its default Validator.
    void
    setPrompt(String prompt)
    Sets the input prompt to a new String value.
    void
    setValidator(Validator validator)
    Sets the internal Validator used for the given prompts.

    Methods inherited from class Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler()
      Constructs a InputHandler instance with a default generic Validator and a default prompt of "default prompt".

  • Method Details

    • setPrompt

      public void setPrompt(String prompt)
      Sets the input prompt to a new String value.
      Parameters:
      prompt - - the new String value to set the internal prompt to for future use when calling .get()

    • setValidator

      public void setValidator(Validator validator)
      Sets the internal Validator used for the given prompts.
      Parameters:
      validator - - the validator we wish to use to validate user input.

    • get

      public String get()
      Prints out the current prompt and requests user input, checks that input against the Validator isValid method to determine if the InputHandler can return that input or if it has to ask the user again. Maximum number of 9999 checks per time .get() is called, to safeguard against infinite loop.
      Returns:
      the input assessed as valid by the Validator currently held by InputHandler

    • resetValidator

      public void resetValidator()
      Resets the InputHandler to its default Validator.
